bibl.title: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, February 23, 1948

div1.p: Wyllie appreciates the copy of Hench's speech on Reed. He mentions that he has heard rumors that Hench might speak at the local historical society meeting.

div1.head: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, February 23, 1948
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
23 February 1948
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I am ever so much obliged to you for the copy of
your talk. Rumors are flying around here that we may have
the opportunity of hearing you again this spring before the
local historical society, but there has been no official
announcement.
I hope the rumors have some foundation.
div1.closer:
Cordially yours, John Cook Wyllie
Curator of Rare Books Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
